numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph shows percentages of how frequently young men reach out to their parents.
3. The graph shows percentages of how frequently young women reach out to their parents.
4. In general, young men are more likely to reach out through texts.
5. In general, young women are more likely to reach out through texts.
6. About 50% of young men reach out through texts.
7. About 70% of young women reach out through texts.
8. Overall, women are more likely to contact their parents than men.
9. I wonder how this may affect future generations.
10. I wonder how future generations will reach out to parents.
11. Communications between children and their parents may become less likely.
12. If communications between children and their parents become less likely then crimes may increase.
13. Most children depend on their parents for decision making.
14. Most children depend on their parents for education.
15. Most children depend on their parents for guidance on the right path.
16. If communications decrease significantly then most children may begin to depend on themselves.
17. If most children depend on themselves then complete chaos may happen.
18. The headline is: Young People Reaching Out: A Viewpoint on Generational Shifts in Parental Relationships.
